intro: Liriodendron, commonly known as the tulip tree, is a deciduous tree native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Magnoliaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy yellow-green flowers that resemble tulips. The tree has opposite, heart-shaped leaves that turn yellow in the fall, and its bark is smooth and light gray when young. Liriodendron tulipifera is the most common species, and it can grow up to 50 meters tall, making it one of the tallest trees in the eastern United States. The plant is also valued for its ornamental qualities and historical use in timber production.
